      • editUnivInfo

        public int editUnivInfo(java.lang.String school,
                        java.lang.String state,
                        java.lang.String location,
                        java.lang.String control,
                        int numberOfStudents,
                        double percentFemales,
                        double SATVerbal,
                        double SATMath,
                        double expenses,
                        double percentFinancialAid,
                        int numberOfApplicants,
                        double percentAdmitted,
                        double percentEnrolled,
                        int academicsScale,
                        int socialScale,
                        int qualityOfLifeScale)
        edits a universities information
        Parameters:
        school - is the name of the school
        state - is the state that the school is located
        location - is the type of area in which the school is located (i.e. Suburban, Small-city, ...)
        control - specifies who controls the university (i.e. Public, Private, ...)
        numberOfStudents - is the number of students at this university
        percentFemales - is the percentage of females at this university
        SATVerbal - is the average SAT Verbal score, out of 800, for the students at this university
        SATMath - is the average SAT Math score, out of 800, for the students at this university
        expenses - is the annual tuition for this university
        percentFinancialAid - is the percentage of students who received some sort of financial aid from this university
        numberOfApplicants - is the number of students who typically apply to this university
        percentAdmitted - is the percentage of students who are admitted annually to this university
        percentEnrolled - is the percentage of students who are currently enrolled at this university
        academicsScale - is an integer between 1 and 5 (5 being the best) indicating the quality of academics at this university
        socialScale - is an integer between 1 and 5 (5 being the best) indicating the quality of the social life at this university
        qualityOfLifeScale - is an integer between 1 and 5 (5 being the best) indicating the overall quality of life at this university
        Returns:
        int represents the status of the editUnivInfo

                                               java.lang.String u2)
        This methods puts two universities side by side so that they may be compared
        Parameters:
        u1 - the first university to compare
        u2 - the second university to compare
        Returns:
        ArrayList a list of 2 schools

      • searchUniversities

        public java.util.ArrayList<University> searchUniversities(java.lang.String mySchool,
                                                          java.lang.String myState,
                                                          java.lang.String myLocation,
                                                          java.lang.String myControl,
                                                          int minNumStudents,
                                                          int maxNumStudents,
                                                          double minPercentFemale,
                                                          double maxPercentFemale,
                                                          double minSATVerbal,
                                                          double maxSATVerbal,
                                                          double minSATMath,
                                                          double maxSATMath,
                                                          double minExpenses,
                                                          double maxExpenses,
                                                          double minPercentFinancialAid,
                                                          double maxPercentFinancialAid,
                                                          int minNumApplicants,
                                                          int maxNumApplicants,
                                                          double minPercentAdmitted,
                                                          double maxPercentAdmitted,
                                                          double minPercentEnrolled,
                                                          double maxPercentEnrolled,
                                                          int minAcademicsScale,
                                                          int maxAcademicsScale,
                                                          int minSocialScale,
                                                          int maxSocialScale,
                                                          int minQualityOfLife,
                                                          int maxQualityOfLife)
        This method searches for schools that meet the criteria entered as parameters
        Parameters:
        mySchool - mySchool is the name of the school
        myState - is the state that the school is located
        myLocation - is the type of area in which the school is located (i.e. Suburban, Small-city, ...)
        myControl - specifies who controls the university (i.e. Public, Private, ...)
        minNumStudents - is the min number of students desired at a university
        maxNumStudents - is the max number of students desired at a university
        minPercentFemale - is the min percentage of females desired at a university
        maxPercentFemale - is the max percentage of females desired at a university
        minSATVerbal - is the min average SAT Verbal score, out of 800, for the students at a university
        maxSATVerbal - is the max average SAT Verbal score, out of 800, for the students at a university
        minSATMath - is the min average SAT Math score, out of 800, for the students at a university
        maxSATMath - is the max average SAT Math score, out of 800, for the students at a university
        minExpenses - is the min annual tuition for a university
        maxExpenses - is the max annual tuition for a university
        minPercentFinancialAid - is the min percentage of students who received some sort of financial aid from a university
        maxPercentFinancialAid - is the max percentage of students who received some sort of financial aid from a university
        minNumApplicants - is the min number of students who typically apply to this university
        maxNumApplicants - is the max number of students who typically apply to this university
        minPercentAdmitted - is the min percentage of students who are admitted annually to a university
        maxPercentAdmitted - is the max percentage of students who are admitted annually to a university
        minPercentEnrolled - is the min percentage of students who are currently enrolled at this university
        maxPercentEnrolled - is the max percentage of students who are currently enrolled at this university
        minAcademicsScale - is an integer between 1 and 5 (5 being the best) indicating the min quality of academics at this university
        maxAcademicsScale - is an integer between 1 and 5 (5 being the best) indicating the max quality of academics at this university
        minSocialScale - is an integer between 1 and 5 (5 being the best) indicating the min quality of the social life at this university
        maxSocialScale - is an integer between 1 and 5 (5 being the best) indicating the max quality of the social life at this university
        minQualityOfLife - is an integer between 1 and 5 (5 being the best) indicating the min overall quality of life at this university
        maxQualityOfLife - is an integer between 1 and 5 (5 being the best) indicating the max overall quality of life at this university
        Returns:
        ArrayList an array list of university objects that matched search criteria

      • addUniversity

        public int addUniversity(java.lang.String school,
                         java.lang.String state,
                         java.lang.String location,
                         java.lang.String control,
                         int numberOfStudents,
                         double percentFemales,
                         double SATVerbal,
                         double SATMath,
                         double expenses,
                         double percentFinancialAid,
                         int numberOfApplicants,
                         double percentAdmitted,
                         double percentEnrolled,
                         int academicsScale,
                         int socialScale,
                         int qualityOfLifeScale)
        method allows admin to add a university to the database with all the given information
        Parameters:
        School - (name of university)
        State - (name of state university is in)
        Location - (name of location of the university)
        Control - (name of person who controls university)
        numberOfStudents - (number of students attending university)
        percentFemales - (percentage of students attending university that are female)
        SATVerbal - (average score of student at university on SAT Verbal)
        SATMath - (average score of student at university on SAT Math)
        expenses - (cost of expenses for students attending university)
        percentFinancialAid - (percent of financial aid offered to accepted students at university)
        numberOfApplicants - (number of people who applied to university)
        percentAdmitted - (percent of applicants accepted to university)
        percentEnrolled - (percent of accepted applicants who enrolled at the university)
        academicsScale - (a number between 1 and 5 with 5 being the best indicating the quality of academics at the university)
        socialScale - (a number between 1 and 5 with 5 being the best indicating the quality of the social atmosphere at the university)
        qualityOfLifeScale - (a number between 1 and 5 with 5 being the best indicating the quality of the students' lives at the university)
        Returns:
        int the status of the university being added

      • editUniversity

        public int editUniversity(java.lang.String school,
                          java.lang.String state,
                          java.lang.String location,
                          java.lang.String control,
                          int numberOfStudents,
                          double percentFemales,
                          double SATVerbal,
                          double SATMath,
                          double expenses,
                          double percentFinancialAid,
                          int numberOfApplicants,
                          double percentAdmitted,
                          double percentEnrolled,
                          int academicsScale,
                          int socialScale,
                          int qualityOfLifeScale)
        method allows admin to edit information about a university given the current criteria.
        Parameters:
        School - (name of university)
        State - (name of state university is in)
        Location - (name of location of the university)
        Control - (name of person who controls university)
        numberOfStudents - (number of students attending university)
        percentFemales - (percentage of students attending university that are female)
        SATVerbal - (average score of student at university on SAT Verbal)
        SATMath - (average score of student at university on SAT Math)
        expenses - (cost of expenses for students attending university)
        percentFinancialAid - (percent of financial aid offered to accepted students at university)
        numberOfApplicants - (number of people who applied to university)
        percentAdmitted - (percent of applicants accepted to university)
        percentEnrolled - (percent of accepted applicants who enrolled at the university)
        academicsScale - (a number between 1 and 5 with 5 being the best indicating the quality of academics at the university)
        socialScale - (a number between 1 and 5 with 5 being the best indicating the quality of the social atmosphere at the university)
        qualityOfLifeScale - (a number between 1 and 5 with 5 being the best indicating the quality of the students' lives at the university)
        Returns:
        int the status of the edit
